row.name: Time since page load
row.description: Calculates the time that has passed since the page was loaded.

row.name: unit
row.title: Unit
row.description: Select in which unit you want to retrieve the time.

row.name: Custom JavaScript
row.description: Executes a custom JavaScript function to retrieve the value.

row.name: jsFunction
row.title: JavaScript Function
row.description: The value should start with "function() { " and end with "return yourValue; }". You have to define a function and return a value. We highly recommend to test the pasted JavaScript function to avoid JavaScript errors on your website.

row.name: DOM Element
row.description: Gets the value from a DOM element.

row.name: selectionMethod
row.title: Selection Method
row.description: Select the way you want to identify the element you want to read the value from.

row.name: cssSelector
row.title: CSS Selector
row.description: A CSS selector allows you to select an element by id, className, element names, etc. If multiple elements match this selector, the first matching element will be used to get the value from. Examples for valid selectors are ".classname", "#id" or "li a".

row.name: elementId
row.title: Element ID
row.description: The id attribute specifies a unique id for an HTML element. Insert here the value of an ID attribute of any element within your website.

row.name: attributeName
row.title: Attribute Name
row.inlineHelp: If a value is entered, the value of the attribute will be returned instead of the text content of the element.

row.name: Data-Layer
row.description: Reads a custom value from the Data-Layer.
row.help: Using this variable you can access any value that is stored within the dataLayer. You can also push values to the dataLayer yourself and access them this way afterwards.

row.name: dataLayerName
row.title: Data Layer Variable Name
row.description: The name of any variable that is stored within the dataLayer. In case you want to access the value of a nested object, you can access the value of an object by separating each property by a dot, for example "object1.myPropertyOfObject1".

row.name: First-Party Cookie
row.description: Reads a value from a cookie

row.name: urlDecode
row.title: URI-decode Cookie
row.inlineHelp: If enabled, the value will be decoded

row.name: JavaScript Variable
row.description: Reads the value of a global JavaScript variable.

row.name: variableName
row.title: JavaScript Variable Name
row.description: The name of any variable that is available within the global scope. In case you want to access the value of a nested object, you can access the value of an object by separating each property by a dot, for example "document.referrer".

row.name: Referrer URL
row.description: Gets the value of the Referrer URL.

row.name: urlPart
row.title: URL Part
row.description: Select the part of the URL you want to retrieve.

row.name: URL Parameter
row.description: Gets the value of a specific URL parameter.

row.name: parameterName
row.title: URL Parameter Name
row.description: For example when your page has URL parameters such as "?lang=NZ" and you want to get the value "NZ", then you need to enter "lang".

row.name: URL Variable
row.description: Gets the value of the current page URL.

row.name: urlPart
row.title: URL Part
row.description: Select the part of the URL you want to retrieve.

row.name: Page Meta Content
row.description: Reads a value from a "meta" HTML element.

row.name: Constant
row.description: The variable is set to a fixed value.

row.name: etrackerID
row.title: etracker ID
row.description: The etracker ID you want to track data into. The ID is required. You may find the ID of your website under "Administration => Setup/Tracking Code" in etracker.

row.name: etrackerDNT
row.title: Respect Do Not Track in etracker

row.name: et_pagename
row.title: Variable et_pagename
row.description: Set variable if you want to overwrite the default value

row.name: et_areas
row.title: Variable et_areas
row.description: Set variable if you want to overwrite the default value

row.name: et_target
row.title: Variable et_target
row.description: Set variable if you want to overwrite the default value

row.name: et_tval
row.title: Variable et_tval
row.description: Set variable if you want to overwrite the default value

row.name: et_tonr
row.title: Variable et_tonr
row.description: Set variable if you want to overwrite the default value

row.name: et_tsale
row.title: Variable et_tsale
row.description: Set variable if you want to overwrite the default value

row.name: et_basket
row.title: Variable et_basket
row.description: Set variable if you want to overwrite the default value

row.name: et_cust
row.title: Variable et_cust
row.description: Set variable if you want to overwrite the default value

row.name: customDimensions
row.title: Custom Dimensions
row.description: Optionally set one or multiple custom dimensions.

row.name: Matomo Configuration
row.description: Defines a configuration for Matomo Analytics.

row.name: matomoUrl
row.title: Matomo URL
row.description: The URL of your Matomo instance. It should not include "/index.php" or "piwik.php". The URL of your current Matomo URL instance is preconfigured.

row.name: idSite
row.title: Matomo idSite
row.description: The idSite you want to track data into. The idSite of the current website is preconfigured. You may also find the idSite of any other website under "Administration => Manage Measurables/Websites".

row.name: enableLinkTracking
row.title: Enable Link Tracking
row.description: Enables the automatic download and outlink tracking.

row.name: enableFileTracking
row.title: Enable File Tracking
row.description: Enable tracking of file:// protocol actions. By default, the file:// protocol is not tracked.

row.name: enableCrossDomainLinking
row.title: Enable Cross Domain Linking
row.description: Enable this to accurately measure the same visitor across multiple domain names.

row.name: crossDomainLinkingTimeout
row.title: Cross Domain Linking Timeout
row.description: Set the cross domain linking timeout (in seconds). By default, the two visits across domains will be linked together when the link is clicked and the page is loaded within a 180 seconds timeout window.

row.name: enableDoNotTrack
row.title: Enable Do Not Track
row.description: Enable this feature to not track users who opt out of tracking using Mozilla's (proposed) Do Not Track setting
row.inlineHelp: Note: When enabled it sets _paq.push(["setDoNotTrack", true]); which will not send any tracking request when a visitor has DNT enabled unlike the "DNT Matomo Setting" which drops the request on the server when a visitor has DNT enabled.

row.name: disablePerformanceTracking
row.title: Disable Performance Tracking
row.description: Disables page performance tracking.

row.name: enableJSErrorTracking
row.title: Enable JavaScript Error Tracking
row.description: Enables the tracking of uncaught JavaScript errors as an event.

row.name: enableHeartBeatTimer
row.title: Enable HeartBeat Timer
row.description: Install a Heart beat timer that will regularly send requests to Matomo in order to better measure the time spent on the page.

row.name: heartBeatTime
row.title: HeartBeat Time
row.description: The time interval in seconds in which to send pings. Can not be lower then 5s.

row.name: trackAllContentImpressions
row.title: Track All Content Impressions
row.description: Enables the content tracking feature by scanning the entire DOM for all content blocks and tracks all impressions once the page has loaded.

row.name: trackVisibleContentImpressions
row.title: Track Visible Content Impressions
row.description: Enables the content tracking feature by scanning the entire DOM for all content blocks but only tracks content impressions once the user scrolls to the content and the content is actually visible.

row.name: disableCookies
row.title: Disable cookies
row.description: Disables all first party cookies.

row.name: requireConsent
row.title: Require tracking consent
row.description: Track only when user gave tracking consent. In a consent screen you need to call "window._paq=window._paq||[];window._paq.push(['rememberConsentGiven']);" when the user gives consent.

row.name: requireCookieConsent
row.title: Require cookie consent
row.description: Use cookies only if the user gave cookie consent, otherwise track the user without cookies. In a consent screen you need to call "window._paq=window._paq||[];window._paq.push(['rememberCookieConsentGiven']);" when the user gives consent for cookies.

row.name: customCookieTimeOutEnable
row.title: Enable Custom Cookie Timeouts
row.description: Allows you to set custom timeouts for various cookies.

row.name: customCookieTimeOut
row.title: Visitor Cookie Timeout
row.description: Timeout of pk_id in full days. By default, the Matomo tracking cookie expires in 13 months (365 + 28 days) = 393 days.

row.name: referralCookieTimeOut
row.title: Referral Cookie Timeout
row.description: Timeout of the referral cookie in full days. By default, the Matomo tracking cookie expires in 6 months = 182 days.

row.name: sessionCookieTimeOut
row.title: Session Cookie Timeout
row.description: Timeout of the session cookie in minutes.

row.name: setSecureCookie
row.title: Enable Secure Cookie
row.description: Enable the Secure cookie flag on all first party cookies. This should be used when your website is only available under HTTPS so that all tracking cookies are always sent over secure connection.

row.name: cookieDomain
row.title: Cookie Domain
row.inlineHelp:
The default is the current document domain. If your website can be visited for example at both www.example.com and example.com, you would use: ".example.com" or "*.example.com".
Note: The variable is only evaluated at the time when tracker is being created, make sure you have the variable defined before that.

row.name: cookieNamePrefix
row.title: Cookie Name Prefix
row.description: The name prefix of the cookies.

row.name: cookiePath
row.title: Cookie Path
row.description: When tracking many subdirectories in separate websites, the cookie path prevents the number of cookies to quickly increase and prevent browser from deleting some of the cookies. This ensures optimal data accuracy and improves performance for your users (fewer cookies are sent with each request).

row.name: cookieSameSite
row.title: Same Site Cookie
row.description: Set the SameSite attribute for cookies to a custom value. You might want to use this if your site is running in an iframe since then it will only be able to access the cookies if SameSite is set to "None". Choosing "None" will only work on HTTPS and will automatically also set the secure cookie. If your site is available under http and https, using "None" might lead to duplicate or incomplete visits.

row.name: disableBrowserFeatureDetection
row.title: Disable Browser Feature Detection
row.description: By default, Matomo accesses some information from the visitor’s browser like the browser resolution. Some privacy regulations may allow access of such information from the visitor’s device only after having a consent. If this applies to you, you can disable this feature.
row.inlineHelp: To learn more, check this FAQ.

row.name: domains
row.title: Domains
row.description: Used to detect outlinks. Add hostnames or domains to be treated as local. For wildcard subdomains, you can use: ".example.com" or "*.example.com". You can also specify a path along a domain: "*.example.com/subsite1".

row.name: alwaysUseSendBeacon
row.title: Always use sendBeacon
row.description: Enables sendBeacon usage instead of a regular ajax request. This means when a user clicks for example on an outlink, the navigation to this page will happen much faster.

row.name: disableAlwaysUseSendBeacon
row.title: Disable always use sendBeacon permanently
row.description: Choose to stop using sendBeacon and use a regular AJAX request instead. This might make clicking on external links a bit slower for users, but it won't be stopped by ad blockers.

row.name: userId
row.title: User ID
row.description: Sets a User ID to this user (such as an email address or a username).

row.name: customDimensions
row.title: Custom Dimensions
row.description: Optionally set one or multiple custom dimensions.

row.name: registerAsDefaultTracker
row.title: Register As Default Tracker
row.description: When enabled, the tracker will be registered as the default one for the website, and will receive all commands that get pushed into the global _paq variable. Useful if you want to use the tracker config from the container with your own _paq.push() JavaScript code.

row.name: bundleTracker
row.title: Bundle Tracker
row.description: By bundling the Matomo JavaScript tracker directly into the container it may improve the performance of your website as it reduces the number of needed requests. It is recommended to bundle the Matomo tracker because in most cases the tracker would otherwise be loaded in a separate request on page view anyway. Note: If you use two different Matomo configurations in one container, the setting of the first configuration used in the first Matomo Tag will be applied to all Matomo tags within one container.

row.name: jsEndpoint
row.title: Tracker Javascript Path
row.description: Here you can configure the source path of the Matomo Tracker JavaScript, if you are not using the "Bundle Tracker" option.

row.name: jsEndpointCustom
row.title: Custom Tracker Javascript Path
row.description: Here you can configure a non standard path to fetch the tracker from. Will be appended to the Matomo URL. Should not start with '/'. Keep in mind that, since this is non standard, you have to handle the requests there yourself!

row.name: trackingEndpoint
row.title: Tracking Request Target Path
row.description: Here you can configure the target path for tracking requests.

row.name: trackingEndpointCustom
row.title: Custom Tracking Request Target Path
row.description: Here you can configure a non standard path for tracking requests. Will be appended to the Matomo URL. Should not start with '/'. Keep in mind that, since this is non standard, you have to handle the requests there yourself!

row.name: appendToTrackingUrl
row.title: Append To Tracking Url
row.description: Append a custom string to the end of the HTTP request to matomo.php? (or your selected respective tracking endpoint).

row.name: forceRequestMethod
row.title: Force Request Method
row.description: Enables forcing the request method to either GET or POST.

row.name: requestMethod
row.title: Request Method
row.description: To use the POST request method, either 1) the Matomo host is the same as the tracked website host (Matomo installed in the same domain as your tracked website), or 2) if Matomo is not installed on the same host as your website, you need to enable CORS (Cross domain requests) as explained in this FAQ. Keep in mind that when Matomo uses sendBeacon() for sending tracking requests (which is enabled by default), it will send data via POST. If you want Matomo to never send POST requests, you can use this method to force GET which will automatically disable sendBeacon.

row.name: requestContentType
row.title: Content-Type
row.description: Set request Content-Type header value for POST requests.

row.name: customRequestProcessing
row.title: Custom Request Processing
row.description: Can be set to a variable of type "Custom Request Processing Function" to augment or override default request sending behaviour.
